sen.j: 八条通（はちじょうどおり）は
sen.e: The Hachijo-dori Street is
Hachijo-dori Street is
Hachijo-dori Street is:

sen.j: 京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
(described in this article)
(described in this article)
(described in this article)

sen.j: 旭川市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: one of the major east-west running streets in Asahikawa City.
one of the major east-west streets in Asahikawa City.
one of the major east-west streets in Asahikawa City.

sen.j: 八条通（はちじょうどおり）は京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Hachijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Hachijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Hachijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の八条大路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Hachijo-oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Hachijo-oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Hachijo-oji Street of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 東西はほぼ鴨川 (淀川水系)から桂川 (淀川水系)までを結ぶが、途中、御前通 - 千本通が東海道本線の線路 (鉄道)で分断されている。
sen.e: It runs east-west linking the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) and the Katsuragawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) almost throughout, with the section between the Onmae-dori Street and the Senbon-dori Street divided by the tracks (railway) of the Tokaido Main Line.

It runs east-west linking the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa Water System) and the Katsuragawa River (Yodo-gawa Water System) nearly throughout, with the section between Onmae-dori Street and Senbon-dori Street divided by the tracks (railway) of the Tokaido Main Line.

It runs east-west, linking the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) and the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) nearly throughout, with the section between Onmae-dori Street and Senbon-dori Street divided by the tracks (railway) of the Tokaido Main Line.
sen.cmt: Katsura-gawa River Yodo-gawa River system としました。

sen.j: 京都駅の南側は4車線以上ある大通りで、東海道新幹線の開通によって発展した。
sen.e: With the opening of theTokaido Shinkansen, the 4-lane street north of Kyoto Station has become busy.
With the opening of the Tokaido Shinkansen, the four-lane street north of Kyoto Station has become busy.
With the opening of the Tokaido Shinkansen, the four-lane street south of Kyoto Station has become busy.

sen.j: また、西大路八条には平清盛八条殿跡の碑がたてられた若一神社がある。
sen.e: Nyakuichi-jinja Shrine is located at the corner of Nishioji Hachijo, where a monument is erected indicating it is the historic site of Hchijo-dono of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
Nyakuichi-jinja Shrine is located at the corner of Nishioji Hachijo, where a monument is erected indicating it is the historic site of Hachijo-dono of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
Nyakuichi-jinja Shrine is located at the corner of Nishioji Hachijo, where a monument indicates it as the historic site of Hachijo-dono (the residence in Hachijo) of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: (the residence in Hachijo)と補足しました。

sen.j: そこのクスノキは切ると平清盛の祟りがあるとのことで、京都市電を通すときも避けられたという。
sen.e: A camphor tree on the side of the street has a story; the tracks of the Kyoto city trams were laid out avoiding the tree for fear that cutting it down may invoke a curse of TAIRA no Kiyomari.

A camphor tree on the side of the street has a story; the tracks of the Kyoto city trams were laid out in order to avoid the tree for fear that cutting it down might invoke a curse of TAIRA no Kiyomari.

A camphor tree on the side of the street has a story; the tracks of the Kyoto City Trams were laid out in order to avoid the tree for fear that cutting it down might invoke a curse of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: Kyoto City Trams, Kiyomori に修正

sen.j: そのため、市電が廃止された現在でも西大路通はそこの部分だけ蛇行している。
sen.e: This is why the Nshioji-dori Street is winding in particular in this section even after the City trams were abolished.
This is why Nishioji-dori Street is winding in particular in this section even after the city trams were abolished.
This is why Nishioji-dori Street is a winding one, particularly in this section, even after the abolishment of the City Trams.

sen.j: 上側が東側、下側が西側。
sen.e: East is upper and west is lower.
East is upper and west is lower.
East is upper and west is lower.

sen.j: 左側が北側、右側が南側。
sen.e: North is left and south is right.
North is left and south is right.
North is left and south is right.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
